data.title: Game Critique
data.text:
9 min read

A worthy follow-up to Elden Ring, Shadow of the Erdtree comes across more like a sequel than just a DLC episode.

8 min read

It may be the best Final Fantasy game you’ve never heard of. Final Fantasy Dimensions is an entirely original FF story – on mobile!

14 min read

Skald: Against the Black Priory establishes itself as a loving tribute to classic CRPGs with that little bit of extra modern polish.

7 min read

Revisiting a classic that conceived both the world of Ivalice and a series of beloved tactical RPGs with Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen!

9 min read

Though it has its hiccups, Skies of Arcadia stands tall and proud as a classic of the RPG genre.

6 min read

A remake of the original PC classic, Alone in the Dark for PS5 brings camp, cheese, and scares to the 1930s in the 2020s.

12 min read

Celebrating a masterpiece, Phantasy Star IV presents a large world of fantastic characters, creative enemies, and a timeless narrative.

7 min read

A must play for Genesis fans, Shinobi III is just as fast, as cool, and as full of ninja as you remember.

16 min read

“The object of war is not to die for your country, but make the other…

8 min read

The next Stardew Valley, the next Pokemon, or the next Slay the Spire? Yes. Moonstone Island is an alchemical labor of love.

10 min read

Some mechanical musings on Megaman Battle Network 4 and the curious range of experiences the game may allow any player to have.

8 min read

Worldless is a unique Metroidvania about the chaotic birth of a universe. Journey through the void to discover your purpose and your fate.

13 min read

The wish for a remake of Super Mario RPG has been granted, but we’re strolling down star road to revisit the Super NES original for this critique!

9 min read

Siralim Ultimate provides one of the most in depth creature-collecting and monster-raising RPG experiences on the market today.

7 min read

A critique of the gore-spattered boomer shooter Boltgun from the grimdark Warhammer 40K universe that harkens back to the golden age of FPS.

10 min read

Action figures duke it out with wrestling legends in WrestleQuest, a turn-based RPG from Mega Cat Studios that hits like a pile driver!

8 min read

From its humble origins in arcade antiquity, Rygar came a long way for this Legendary Adventure remake. But does it belong in a museum?

10 min read

Final Fantasy XVI revived my enthusiasm for the series as a whole, celebrating what each game brings to the franchise.

24 min read

Though it may not be for everyone, Planescape: Torment offers both a strong, thoughtful story and some musings on the medium itself.

6 min read

While there is certainly a lot of gameplay to be savored, Stranger of Paradise lacks what makes Final Fantasy great: a great story.

8 min read

In Velocity Noodle, you play as a quick noodle delivery ninja navigating a cyberpunk dystopia. Is this precision platformer up to speed?

20 min read

Regardless of my feelings on the original game, 2023’s Resident Evil 4 ended up being something of a masterpiece.

7 min read

Planet of Lana takes you on an epic journey with a young girl and her alien cat friend on a quest to save Lana’s family from strange robots.

10 min read

Fire Emblem: Engage lives up to its subtitle armed with a host of content and the power of the friendships we made along the way.

6 min read

For those looking to break into the reading world of visual novels, ATRI -My Dear Moments- may be the perfect accessible entry point.

35 min read

Sonic Frontiers gets an analytical breakdown as vast as its open-world setting, courtesy of our resident Sonic expert!

11 min read

Powerful narrative themes and technical upgrades help cement Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII Reunion as a vital part of the compilation.

11 min read

Fly through your underground world with the last Knight Witch in this strange mix of shoot-em-up and Metroidvania.

8 min read

Lil Gator and Big Sis used to play together, but she grew up and doesn’t have time now. Can his Lil Gator Game get his sis’s playfulness back?
